comment: At this point, if you are a teacher and you don't show genuine care for the student, then consider quitting. There is no point in being at KSU and having an attitude when a student is struggling.

Dr. Link is a somewhat difficult professor. The directions to some of her work is kinda difficult to comprehend, and has multiple parts to it. Not straightforward at all. Very hard to get into contact with her, have to email her multiple times to get a response. Also hasty & rude to students.

Dr. Link is a very fair and easy grader, but she is brash and rude to students. She is extremely unfair when it comes to any technology issues, including issues caused by her online calendar. She expects students to speak formally and respectfully to her, but lacks the same decorum in return. Would avoid her but unfortunately you cannot.

The internship class with Dr. Tanja Link was without a doubt the greatest academic experience of my undergrad. I am blessed to have had her in my corner. She champions her students, and always celebrates their success. She gives helpful feedback and pushed us to do our best. She is extremely kind and caring, and does her best to help her students.
She called me irritating which I found to be irritating of her to say. Easy grader, but annoying lady.

best internship coordinator. clear assignments and grading. a lot of activities to keep up with so stay on top of them with your internship. was nervous for my internship experience/class but it went great
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Participation matters--Clear grading criteria

comment: Professor Link has by far been my favorite professor in my 4 semesters so far at Kennesaw. She is great at communicating and her class was set up so well online so that it was very straight forward what was expected of us each week. It's an easy and interesting class! I wish that I could take another one of her classes!
Honestly the best teacher to have for an internship coordinator. All of the requirements are posted on a previous rating. Do the work and earn your grade.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Caring--Gives good feedback

comment: The internship course was great because of Dr. Link. Everything was clear in the syllabus. You have 10 discussion post. A paper about your internship. Get two evaluations done by your internship supervisor. Have two collaborate ultras about your internship. The final is a PowerPoint about your internship. Pretty simple A.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Clear grading criteria--Caring

comment: Took this class online over the summer. I understand that summer courses are condensed and therefor may be a bit more difficult than typical semester long courses. But this class takes the cake. Everything was easy except for her exams. I spent over 12 hours preparing for each exam and barely made a B. They are ridiculous for an intro level class.

Honestly the class is easy but you have to stay dedicated. There are weekly discussion posts where you say your favorite and least favorite thing about the chapter as well as weekly quizzes. There is also additional discussion posts and the first exam was on lockdown browser with webcam (80 questions). Overall the only class I made a B in.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--TEST HEAVY

comment: She was great professor and easy to get along with. The tests are online but very hard.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--Tests? Not many

comment: I mixed up the midterm deadline because of a work emergency and she really worked with me and saved my grade. Midterm and final multiple choice with 4 SHORT answer. Made A on both. Quizzes straight from reading. Only 7 discussions with responses. Weekly journal grade just for completing it. She is so awesome and actually cares about her students.

Took online and loved it. EASY A if you just do the work and keep up with deadlines. Super interesting material and tests are straight from the book. Responds to emails fast, and is quick to correct grades if there is a mess up. I TOTALLY recommend her.

I loved this professor! If you go to class and study you should get an A. Tests are right from the book and she puts up powerpoints. Her attendance policy is a little strict but she does accept excused abscences. I would take her again.
She is a nice lady.  However she doesn't explain things clearly and there is a lot of group work.  I haven't learned a whole lot in her class and the test are a bit confusing as well.

I took this class online. A lot of busy work, but it's doable. Easy m/c, short essay quiz after every module; two tests, one easy paper, discussions, weekly journal entries, four discussions on "My Bloody Life", WIKI (define terms and summarize juvenile criminal cases). Like I said it's a lot of work but you'll be fine.

She is an excellent professor! Loved this class, my only issue is that her test were extremely lengthy especially during short answers which are not so short. I promise I had about 6 pages of essays for 1 exam. As long as you attend class which is very important you will pass the class. Beware of pop quizzes with questions u had to be in class for!

Dr. Link is a good professor. My only complaint is that she has no real life experience, she is just an academic. That being said, tests are straight from the notes and she makes it very clear what will be on quizzes and tests. You should have no problem making an A.

Love This Professor! She is great, the class is always entertaining! I took it on friday so I had it for 2hrs and 45min every week, and not once was I bored! Shes funny, intresting, and a great Prof. Take this class, It made me change my major! Just watch out for attendance shes strict on it. You sign in and out. Overall great class.

Took this class online, it was easy! Read over the power point for test preparation and do all  the assignments and discussions on time and you will end up with an A.She provides a rubric for everything so that you know how to earn an A. I HIGHLY RECOMMEND THIS CLASS.
Dr Link is a very unfair teacher. Attendance is very IMPORTANT! The tests were online which was helpful. She will not help you out at all! You will receive the grade you deserve.

She was very funny and she made the class interesting. Tho i fell asleep a few times but she's great. Passed with a B. All tests plus final online. I didn't buy the book. Power points online as well. Those who failed has no one to blame but themselves. take her. Very helpful.
You def can get an A or B if you pay attention and take notes. Tests are online which is good. Shes a real cool laid-back teacher. Make sure you come to class. Attendance is notated

Professor Link is pretty easy as long as you read, take notes, and listen. Also studying is IMPORTANT. Online tests are awesome. I didn't do so well in her class just because I was slacking off..... :O If you TRY, you will SUCCEED!

Decent teacher. Pretty easy to understand. The mandatory attendance policy sucks. The class has online tests which is always nice. The book is very easy to read and will help your understanding of the material.
Reading the book would have helped a great deal. Otherwise, learning objectives and tests were clear. She's not terrible to look at either, which helped as well.
Easy class if you attend and take notes, reading along in the book is helpful but not necessary. She is pretty cute too.
